title: Pakistan 'Vigilantes' Behind Rise In Online Blasphemy Cases
content: Hundreds of young men are standing trial in Pakistan courts, accused of making blasphemous statements online or in WhatsApp groups, an offence for which arrests have exploded in recent years.
summary: Hundreds of young men are standing trial in Pakistan courts, accused of making blasphemous statements online or in WhatsApp groups, an offence for which arrests have exploded in recent years.

title: Seeing Double In 'Twins Capital Of World': Almost Every Family Has Them
content: The global average birth rate for twins is around 12 per 1,000 births -- but in Igbo-Ora, it is thought to be closer to 50 per 1,000, according to scientific studies and hospital records.
summary: The global average birth rate for twins is around 12 per 1,000 births -- but in Igbo-Ora, it is thought to be closer to 50 per 1,000, according to scientific studies and hospital records.

title: Is Life Possible On Europa, Jupiter Moon? NASA To Investigate
content: The Europa Clipper mission will allow the US space agency to uncover new details about the moon, which scientists believe could hold an ocean of liquid water beneath its icy surface.
summary: The Europa Clipper mission will allow the US space agency to uncover new details about the moon, which scientists believe could hold an ocean of liquid water beneath its icy surface.

title: "Trump Should Do The Same": Harris After Releasing Medical Report
content: Kamala Harris urged voters to question Donald Trumps transparency regarding his health and policy plans.
summary: Kamala Harris urged voters to question Donald Trumps transparency regarding his health and policy plans.

title: North Korea Set To Blow Up Cross-Border Roads With South: Seoul
content: North Korea on Friday accused South Korea of sending drones to scatter a "huge number" of anti-North leaflets over Pyongyang.
summary: North Korea on Friday accused South Korea of sending drones to scatter a "huge number" of anti-North leaflets over Pyongyang.

title: DNA Study Shows Christopher Columbus Was A Jew From Spain
content: The research, led by Spanish scientists suggests Christopher Columbus concealed Sephardic Jewish roots to escape persecution.
summary: The research, led by Spanish scientists suggests Christopher Columbus concealed Sephardic Jewish roots to escape persecution.

title: What Is THAAD, The Advanced US Anti-Missile Battery Being Sent To Israel
content: The United States has deployed one of its most advanced missile defence systems, the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), along with 100 US troops to Israel.
summary: The United States has deployed one of its most advanced missile defence systems, the Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), along with 100 US troops to Israel.

title: Scientists Uncover Car-Sized Insect That Roamed Earth 340 Million Years Ago
content: Despite its massive size, the creature's diet was likely just vegetation from the forests it lived in.
summary: Despite its massive size, the creature's diet was likely just vegetation from the forests it lived in.

title: Israel Awaits THAAD Anti-Missile System From US As Hezbollah Ups Strikes
content: In response to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, the Pentagon has announced the deployment of an advanced anti-missile defence system, the Terminal High-Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), to Israel.
summary: In response to the ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah, the Pentagon has announced the deployment of an advanced anti-missile defence system, the Terminal High-Altitude Area Defense (THAAD), to Israel.

title: WHO-Palestine Red Crescent Operation Resupply 2 Hospitals In Northern Gaza
content: The resupply mission also delivered 20,000 litres of fuel to keep Kamal Adwan and Al-Awda operational, and 23,000 litres of fuel to Al-Sahaba Hospital, along with 800 units of blood and essential medicines and supplies.
summary: The resupply mission also delivered 20,000 litres of fuel to keep Kamal Adwan and Al-Awda operational, and 23,000 litres of fuel to Al-Sahaba Hospital, along with 800 units of blood and essential medicines and supplies.

title: Technology Helps Singapore Economy Grow 4.1% In Quarter 3
content: Singapore's economy grew more than expected in the third quarter as a rush for all things linked to artificial intelligence drove up demand for computer chips, according to preliminary data.
summary: Singapore's economy grew more than expected in the third quarter as a rush for all things linked to artificial intelligence drove up demand for computer chips, according to preliminary data.

title: China Launches Military Drills Around Taiwan, Sends A "Stern Warning"
content: China's drills come days after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned Beijing against taking action in response to a speech by Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te during the island's National Day celebrations.
summary: China's drills come days after US Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned Beijing against taking action in response to a speech by Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te during the island's National Day celebrations.

title: "Move Lebanon Peacekeepers Out Of Harm's Way, Right Now": Netanyahu To UN
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called on the UN chief to move peacekeepers deployed in south Lebanon out of "harm's way", saying Hezbollah was using them as "human shields".
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called on the UN chief to move peacekeepers deployed in south Lebanon out of "harm's way", saying Hezbollah was using them as "human shields".

title: US Elections 2024: 'Stolen Satire' Feeds Misinformation
content: Content from satirical websites is being repurposed to fuel political misinformation and sow confusion ahead of the November 5 US presidential election.
summary: Content from satirical websites is being repurposed to fuel political misinformation and sow confusion ahead of the November 5 US presidential election.

title: 4 Israeli Soldiers Killed In Hezbollah Drone Strike On Military Base
content: Israel's military said a Hezbollah drone had killed four soldiers at one of its northern bases Sunday, as it expanded its bombardments of Lebanon and troops battled militants across the border.
summary: Israel's military said a Hezbollah drone had killed four soldiers at one of its northern bases Sunday, as it expanded its bombardments of Lebanon and troops battled militants across the border.

title: Who Will Receive Nobel Economics Prize 2024?
content: The Norwegian Nobel Committee will announce the Nobel economics prize on Monday, with specialists on credit, the role of government, and wealth inequality seen as possible contenders.
summary: The Norwegian Nobel Committee will announce the Nobel economics prize on Monday, with specialists on credit, the role of government, and wealth inequality seen as possible contenders.

title: Israel-Hezbollah War: Villagers 'Trapped' In South Lebanon Crossfire
content: "Life has stopped since October 2023," said Milad al-Alam, Mayor of village Rmeish, saying most commercial activity had come to a halt since Hezbollah started launching rockets across the border into Israel.
summary: "Life has stopped since October 2023," said Milad al-Alam, Mayor of village Rmeish, saying most commercial activity had come to a halt since Hezbollah started launching rockets across the border into Israel.

title: Man With Shotgun And Loaded Handgun Arrested Near Trump's California Rally
content: The incident comes on the heels of two assassination attempts -- one in Pennsylvania in which a bullet grazed Trump's ear, and a second, aborted attempt at his Florida golf course.
summary: The incident comes on the heels of two assassination attempts -- one in Pennsylvania in which a bullet grazed Trump's ear, and a second, aborted attempt at his Florida golf course.

title: Four Dead After Tesla's Electric Car Catches Fire In France
content: Tesla's electric car caught fire outside the city of Niort, killing the driver and three passengers who were employees at a restaurant in nearby Melle.
summary: Tesla's electric car caught fire outside the city of Niort, killing the driver and three passengers who were employees at a restaurant in nearby Melle.

title: "Deeply Sorry": Italy Bank Apologises For Security Breach Involving Meloni
content: Italy's biggest bank Intesa Sanpaolo apologised on Sunday for an embarrassing security breach that reportedly targeted Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and other highprofile figures.
summary: Italy's biggest bank Intesa Sanpaolo apologised on Sunday for an embarrassing security breach that reportedly targeted Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni and other highprofile figures.
